body.description: The word "$1" exists in the dictionary, but means something different in this context.
Ordet "$1" findes i ordbogen, men betyder noget andet i denne kontekst.
Oqaaseq "$1" ordbogimiippoq oqaatsilli makku ataqatigiinnerannut tulluarani.
The word "$1" exists in the dictionary, but means something different in this context.
Ordet "$1" findes i ordbogen, men betyder noget andet i denne kontekst.
Oqaaseq "$1" ordbogimiippoq oqaatsilli makku ataqatigiinnerannut tulluarani.
Taggisip naanera piffilerutaassaaq
Use Relative instead of Absolutive for subject of transitive verb
Hvis et subjekt, her "$1", står til et transitivt verb, her "$2", skal det stå i relativ og ikke i absolutiv.
Susoq, uani "$1", oqaluummut susalimmut atagaangat, uunga "$2", allamoorutaasassaaq taasiinnarniutaanani.
Use Absolutive instead of Relative for subject of intransitive verb
Hvis et subjekt, her "$1", står til et intransitivt verb, her "$2", skal det stå i Absolutiv og ikke i Relativ.
Susoq, uani "$1", oqaluummut susaatsumut atagaangat, uunga "$2", taasiinnarniutaassaaq allamoorutaanani.

header.title: The word has a wrong ending. Use Terminalis case instead of Absolutive case
Brug ablativ istedet for absolutiv
Piffilerut atoruk taasiinnarniut pinnagu

body.description: The case ending of "$1" should be in the terminalis to express (atatillugu=in connection) with
Kasusendelsen på "$1" skal være i terminalis for at udtrykke (atatillugu=i forbindelse) med
Naaneq uani atorneqartoq "$1" piffilerutaassaaq, oqaluut "atatillugu" pineqartillugu

header.title: There should be case (and number) agreement in noun phrases
Der skal være kasus (og numerus) kongruens i nominale fraser
Taggisini malittariinni naanertigut naapertuunneqassaaq

body.description: The case ending of "$1" needs to be the same as the case ending of "$2"
Inflect the noun "$2" and its modifier "$1" in singular, when "$4" is in singular
Bøj navneordet "$2" og dets adled "$1" i ental og ikke flertal, når "$4" er i ental
Taggit "$2" ilaliussartaalu "$1" ataasersiutaassapput, "$4" ataasersiutaatillugu
When the object of a transitive verb, here "$8" is in plural, there has to be added a suffix added and the inflection changed in the verb "$8"
Oqaluutip susallip susaa "$2" kinaassusersiutit pingajuanni qasseersiutaatillugu oqaluut "$1" uiguuserneqarlunilu naleqquttumik naanilerneqassaaq

header.title: Weekday should be noun form in relative case
Ugedagen skal være i nominal form i relativ kasus
Sapaatip akunnerata ullua taggisaassaaq allamoorummik naanilik

body.description: The word that designates a weekday "$1" should be a noun in relative case, when it modifies a possessed noun "$2"
Ordet, der betegner en ugedag skal være et nomen i relativ kasus, når det er adled til et nomen med possessormarkering
Oqaaseq sapaatip akunnerata ulluanut tunngasoq "$1" taggisaassaaq allamoorummik naanilik, taggimmut pigisamut imaattumut "$2" ilaliussaaguni
The head noun is placed before modifying nouns
Kernen i nominalfrasen står før adleddet
Malittariinni taggisaasuni qitiusortaq ilaliussap siulianiittarpoq
The head noun is placed before modifying nouns
Kernen i nominalfrasen står før adleddet
Malittariinni taggisaasuni qitiusortaq ilaliussap siulianiittarpoq
There are two ways to fix this error. You need to change either verb inflection (to transitive) or object case (to instrumental)

header.title: Use ablative case instead of instrumental case
Brug ablativ istedet for instrumentalis
Aallarfilerut atoruk atortulerut pinnagu

body.description: The case ending of "$1" should be in the ablative case to express "from" or "of"
Kasusendelsen på "$1" skal være i ablativ for at udtrykke "fra" eller "af"
Naaneq uani atorneqartoq "$1" aallarfilerutaassaaq, suminngaanneersoqarneranik oqaatiginninniarnermi

header.title: The word should have an -it ending (ablative case)
Brug ablativ kasus
Aallarfilerut atoruk

body.description: The ending -miik does not exist in Greenlandic
Endelsen på "$1" er ikke en kasus i grønlandsk
Naaneq uani atorneqartoq "$1" kalaallisut taggisinut naanerunngilaq

header.title: "$1" seems misspelled
"$1" ser ud til at være stavet forkert
"$1" naqinnerlugaarpasippoq

body.description: The word "$1" seems to be misspelled.
Ordet "$1" ser ud til at være stavet forkert.
Oqaaseq "$1" naqinnerlugaarpasippoq.
You have used wrong kind of guillemets
Du har brugt forkert type af citationstegn
Isaasat kukkusut atorsimavatit
You have used three periods, "$1". Here an ellipsis would have been a better choice.
Du har brugt tre punktummer, "$1". Her ville ellipse have været et bedre valg.
Naggat pingasoriarlugu atorsimavat, "$1". Minitsissutit atorukkit pitsaanerussaaq.
